title: (x) Greek restaurant font - (similar to) Xerxes {Ignacio, David Hamuel}
content:
Can you pls advise how this font is called which is often used for greek restaurants- cannot find it anywhere...   
attachment showing name of restaurant SAMOS on this webpage:   
 [http://www.shakeman.de/samos.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20110504004838/http:/www.shakeman.de/samos.html)   
Thanks a lot!
author: anonymous

comments.content:
I think this one is closer, more condensed though.   
   
 [http://www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=206766](http://web.archive.org/web/20110504004838/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=206766)

Xerxes   
   
   
   
   
   
   
   
   
David Hamuel   
   
   
p.s. i'll post a sample.

Ignacio,   
   
i didn't check your link (before i posted). yes. this is xerxes.   
   
   
   
David Hamuel

Yes, I was going to write you something like this:   
   
David,   
   
Did you read my post ?   
   
Did you read?   
   
Did you read?   
   
;)   
   
   
Take it easy man, bad week?
I hope it's understand it this way, I think this is the first time I use a ;) !

i know   
i know   
i know   
i know   
   
 ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20110504004838im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

Ignacio LOL.   
   
David nothing personal, this is all friendly banter   
I can assure you.

PS Steffi if you want to convey a Hellenic atmosphere   
without resorting to clich

[This](http://web.archive.org/web/20110504004838/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/lithos/) is not an exact match but it sure is used all over   
greek restaurants and the like...
